And so, if I find any way open to me to deal with the matter of your fortunes, that is to say, your reinstatement in your rights—for everything depends upon that and what they tell me makes me daily more disposed to be hopeful about it—then I shall deal with it personally and energetically.

1 need not go into details. All my devotion and 3 friendliness I lay at your feet without reserve. But it is of great importance to me that all your people should know this, and all that is required is a letter from you, so that they may understand that whatever belongs to Cicero is at the disposal of Trebianus. My object in doing this is to convince them that· nothing is so difficult but that my undertaking it on your behalf would be a pleasure.
